text: Amram Zur (died 2005Obit) was a member of the Jewish Brigade and later became the first travel ministry commissioner for North America. He was instrumental in increasing the number of visitors to Israel in the 1970s and 1980shttp://www.travelweekly.com/Destinations2001-2007/Israel-awards-those- who-developed-tourism/ and organized the first "peace cruise" travelling between Israel and Egypt.Peace could benefit tourism ==References== ==External links== *photo with caption *Henry Cohen Interview *Their roles may be reversed Amram Zur 50 as director general of... * Category:British Army soldiers Category:2005 deaths Category:Israeli people of American descent Category:Mandatory Palestine military personnel of World War II Category:Jewish Brigade personnel
title: Amram Zur
